page.title: 20RAILWAY STATION
page.content:
IN THE 1840S A LINE WAS OPENED BETWEEN DEREHAM AND KINGS LYNN BY THE GREAT EASTERN RAILWAYS AND WAS SITUATED ON THE DUNHAM ROAD ON THE OUTSKIRTS OF GREAT FRANSHAM.
THERE WAS JUST ONE PLATFORM SERVING BOTH DIRECTIONS WITH TWO PORTERS (GRADE 1 & 2)> THE GATE ACROSS THE DUBHAM/FRANSHAM ROAD WERE OPERATED MANUALLY AND THERE WAS A SIGNAL BOX ACROSS THE TRACK FROM THE STATION MASTERS HOUSE/TICKET OFFICE.
THE LINE EVENTUALLY WAS TAKEN OVER BY BRITISH RAIL AND TRAINS WERE CUT TO A LESS FREQUENT SERVICE AND FINALLY WAS CLOSED IN 1969. THE HOUSE WAS RECENTLY SOLD AND IS USED AS A HOLIDAY COTTAGE.
